lines.text: Dad, just for once don't you want to try something new?
Oh Lisa, trying is just the first step toward failure.
I hope I didn't brain my damage.
Welcome to Santa's Village, where it's Christmas everyday! Closed on Christmas.
Homer, it's easy to criticize.
Fun, too.
Dad, I can't believe you're risking my life to save your own.
Son, you'll understand one day, when you have kids.
Sitting that close to the TV is bad for your health.
Talking to me while I'm watching TV is bad for your health.
Kids, just because I don't care doesn't mean I'm not listening.
[Lisa is strangling Bart]
Lisa, no. Your hands are too weak.
[begins strangling Bart]
never help anyone.
Oh, I'm in no condition to drive. Wait a minute. I don't have to listen to myself. I'm drunk.
Hi, Super Nintendo Chalmers!

[after doing or saying something stupid]
D'oh!
You know, a man came into the store today and asked for change for a dollar, and I accidentally gave him three quarters. Took me all afternoon just to track him down.

[shopping for his wife at a women's clothing store]
My wife's looking for something that doesn't make her look like a horse, so, I'm gonna be here for a while
Whoa, slow down there maestro. There's a NEW Mexico?
Smithers, release the hounds.

[Comforting]
There, there. Shut up boy.
Oh boy, it looks like it's suicide again for me.
Beer. Now there's a temporary solution.

[Giving a talk to inspire the school]
Okay, I'm going to keep this short. Friends, family, religion. These are the demons you must slay if you wish to succeed in business. Any questions?
Take that, Lisa's beliefs!
Ahh, now to spend some quality time away from my family.
Ay, carumba!
Hi Fat Tony! Still in the Mafia?
Er, yes, Homer. Thanks for asking.
I think we'd be all better off if each country had its own planet.
Ah, my first kiss! I remember it like it was yesterday!
[a thought bubble appears and fills up with static]
Uh-oh.
Boy, everyone is stupid except me.
Its been three days and my mind is clearer, my sperm count is up and I'm able to recognise simple shapes and patterns.
Dad, you just said that three minutes ago.
You failed, Seymour. What is it with you and failure?
That was from a Dream Sequence! It never really happened.
None of these things ever really happened!
Get out of my Store!

[Gasps]
You mean the Mafia only did me a favour to get something in return? I will say Good Day to you, Sir!

[Thoroughly ashamed]
Okay, I will go.
[Leaves through the fire exit]
Hey, wait a minute!
Hi-diddly-ho, neighbourino!
Our differences are only skin deep, but our sames go down to the bone.
There's no shame in being a pariah.
Talk to the audience? Oh, this part is always death.

[Defending himself in Court]
If these Celebrities didn't want people going through their garbage or saying they're Gay, they should not have expressed themselves creatively...

[Homer is a Bounty Hunter]
Stop in the name of a Private Citizen with no connection to the Law!
This is Moleman in the Morning. Good Moleman to you! And now, continuing the series on the terrible pain in which I live every day...

[slapping Lisa]
Don't hit Maggie. She's just a baby.

[slapping Bart]
Don't hit Lisa. She's a girl.

[slapping Homer]
Keep your hands off of him Homer!
Not the swear jar! It's the only thing holding back the filth!
[Swear jar breaks]
Nuttyfudgekins!
Lisa made me do it. She cast a witch's spell on me.
It's spelled Wicca, and it's empowering.
Wicca is just a Hollywood fad.
That's Kabbala, jerk.
We're going to drop him out of a helicopter and see what happens!
[Pats Mr. Teeny]
Aw, don't worry. Nothing's going to happen to you, Mr. Teeny Number 7.
What do you do, follow my Husband around?
Lady, he's putting my kids through College!
[repeated line]
Excellent.
Eat my shorts.
You, sir, are an idiot.
Dr. Nick, the Coroner would like to see you.
The Coroner! I'm so sick of that guy...

[having sabotaged a computer game system]
Well excuse us for making the worst job in the World a little easier. The terrible pay, the constant presence of Death.
But you can't stop them from having their fun!
They should have had their fun before they got here!
Oh, kids are great! You can teach them to hate what you hate!
So, Senator, tell our viewers why they should vote for you?

[Bioduplicated to look like the Senator]
It makes no difference who you vote for! Either way your Planet is Doomed! Doomed!
Well, a refreshingly honest response there from Senator Bob Dole!
Nelson's a troubled little boy. He needs to be isolated. From everyone!
There is no escape from the Kingdom of the Moles! Well, except that.
You should probably see a doctor about this...
OK.

[realizing]
A competent doctor.
D'oh!
Marge, can I go out and play?
Hey, Weiner Boy... where do you think you're going?
Lisa's with writers, now. The happiest people in the World!
Let's not listen.
Lousy Smarch weather.
Mrs Krabappel is in Portland. It turns out the people she hired to deprogram her sister out of that Cult were an even worse Cult.
Oh no, Aliens! Well, I suppose you want to probe me, might as well get it over with.
Stop!
[Tentacles quiver]
We've reached the limits of what rectal probing can teach us...
There's no justice like angry-mob justice.
I feel like such a tool.
You wouldn't understand, Dad, you're not with it!
I was with it once! And then they changed what it was! And now what I'm with isn't it and what's it seems weird and scary to me! And it'll happen to you!
Don't have a cow, man.
I see the light... it burns!

[to Marge]
I toil not on ye Sabbath, Woman. A pox on thee!
'Nuff talk, it's smashin' time.
[repeated lines]
Shut up, Flanders!
Okily-dokily!

[Blundering into the Everyman Casting Session]
Hello, can I have change for a dollar? Also, can I have a dollar?

[Sees Homer as Everyman]
You. Are. Acceptable!
Great, would you like to see me naked?
Oh, there's no nudity in this movie.
What movie?

[On Grampa Simpson's advice, Bart has kissed Nikki]
Today we are gathered to put a stop to something that would have been considered innocent 100 years ago, but which in today's litigious society has been blown completely out of proportion.

[in front of a mugshot of HRH Queen Elizabeth II]
And the Queen will be held without bail until the sample is returned.
You hate your father, don't you?
The guy I really hate right now is your father!
I'm sorry, I was just venting...
Wait, what did my Dad always say?

[Memory bubble]
If you can't build a robot, be a robot!

[sitting in a fighter plane's cockpit at the school fair]
Pow, pow, pow! Take that Mom and Dad! Send me to a child psychiatrist, will you?
[the ejector seat goes off and sends him flying]

[cage-fighting]
I don't want to sound like a killjoy, but because this is not to my taste I don't think anyone else should be allowed to enjoy it.
[repeated line]
Ahoy-hoy?/!
Take my room-mate away, he's dead!

[dressed as a caveman with a bone through his green hair]
My opinions are as valid as the next man's!
I'm a public servant, Seymour, I'm not allowed to use my own judgement in any way whatsoever.
I am the Angel of Death. Soon the Hour of Purification will be at hand.
Smithers, get this bedlamite an alienist!

[the Parson is coming]
Please try and relax.
But he's like the Pope of this thing!

[Not happy with the "Puma Pride" mural]
The shapely female form has no place in Art!
[repeated line]
Well, I'm bored.
I'll need three ships and fifty stout men. We'll sail around the Horn and return with spices and silk, the likes of which ye have never seen.
We are building a CASINO.
Aaaaarrr... Can you give me 5 minutes?
[repeated line]
Won't somebody PLEASE think of the children!
This school is a glorified hamster wheel! These stuffed suits can get you through a test, but you will fail the test of life!

[dragging him out]
It's always the good ones that go crazy the fastest.
Alcohol is the only thing that makes life bearable! You must Drink, Always Drink!

[Bart is in an asylum after faking sociopathy to get back at his parents for testing him for it]
How could he go so wrong!
We did everything we could for him during the commercials!
I'm not bad, I just make bad decisions.
Mrs Krabappel? How will we know if we fall in love?
Don't worry children. Most of you will never fall in love, but will marry out of fear of dying alone!

[getting Ned some therapy]
We've tried nothing and we're out of ideas!
Okay, children, that was the Sand film...

[forseeing the Rapture]
In a World this crazy, only a lunatic is truly insane...
Take a last look at the unconditional love in your kid's eyes 'cos when he comes out it'll be gone!
Which is society's fault because...
I'm done working. Working is for chumps.
Son, I'm proud of you. I was twice your age before I figured that out.

[at a company picnic held at Mr Burns' mansion]
Oh, boss. Look what we brought.
[holds up a jello mould]
Gelatine desserts.

[slaps his head]
Oh, for the love of Peter. That's what everybody brought. Some damn fool
[Homer]
went around telling everyone I love that slimy goop.
[motions to a whole collection of jello moulds]
Well, toss it in the pile over there.
[grudgingly]
And make yourselves at home.

You see, kids today listen to the rap music, which gives them the brain damage, with their hippin' and their hoppin' and their bippin' and their boppin', so they don't know what the jazz is all about. You see jazz is like jello pudding, actually it's more like Kodak film. No, jazz is like the New Coke, it'll be around forever, heh-heh-heh.
You see, I've got to get back on the TV! Because with the Osbournes, and the softcore porns and the dogs poopin' and nobody scoopin' and the wah-wah-wah.
What do you like to play?
Pokémon!
Pokémon? With the pokey and the man and the guy comes out with the thing and it makes him fall off the sidewalk wah-wah-wah!
Bolshevism! Sheer Bolshevism! Ripe for the quashing!

[Abe is fronting for his grandkids writing for Itchy & Scratchy]
I get paid $6000 a week to tell a cat and a mouse what to do!
[fantasises about dumping Abe in a Mental Institution]
What was I laughing at? Oh, yes, that crippled Irishman! Ah-ha-ha-ha-ha!
What's that, a broken leg? Great!
It's because they're stupid, that's why everyone does everything.
Mr Hopkins, so sorry, but tonight your pizza, she can't be done.
...Damn you.
[Raises fist]
DAMN YOU TO HELL!
So I guess you could say this barely qualifies as news...
We can't fix your heart, but thanks to modern technology we can tell you exactly how damaged it is!
What an age we live in!
Where are the bodies?

[slams the door on them]
Such a beautiful day! I think I'll go for a walk. Excuse me while I jump out the window.

[flirting at a party]
Sure I'm a Doctor, baby, and I can prescribe anything I want!

[watching instructional surgery film]
Ew, gross, blood!
I suppose you could say I'd like to bring the Milhouse out in Nelson.
But I'm ALL Milhouse!
We've got to get you away from these violent influences and into Church!
And then the Belshazzemites did PIERCE the eyes of their foes and feasted upon what flowed thereforth.
Absotively Posolutely!
History is written by the winners, Dad.
I thought it was written by losers.

[proud of the Bear patrol]
Not a Bear in sight! The Bear patrol is working like a charm.
That's specious reasoning, Dad.
Thank you, honey.
By that logic, I could say this rock keeps tigers away!
Oh yeah, how does it work?
It doesn't. It's just a stupid rock! But I don't see any tigers around here, do you?
Lisa, I'd like to buy your rock...

[Bart's telephone prank]
If I ever find you, I will thank you for teaching me the futility of all Human Endeavour...

[Johnny Newspaperseed Museum]
If he's so smart, how come he's dead?
l hate every ape I see
From chimpanA to chimpanZ
So you'll never make
A monkey out of me!

[people are missing the point of Flanders' "Hell House"]
No! His sin was thinking that women are beautiful!
That's the answer! Pawn to King's Bishop Three!
Moe, it seems to me that everytime I drink too much something like this always happens. Maybe I should...

[Cramming beer down Homer's throat]
Yeah, take your medicine, you lush, ya.
Are you sure this is the casino? Mr. Burns' Casino? I think I should call my manager...
Your manager says for you to shut up!
Vera said that?
[repeated line]
If anyone needs me, I'll be in my room.
[repeated line]
Hrrrrrmmm!
[repeated line]
AAAAAAH! SIDESHOW BOB!
[repeated line]
Hello, Bart.
[repeated line]
Hey-hey, kids!
I don't know why I do what I do
[eats a bag of M&Ms then drinks a two-litre bottle of soda]
Whoa!
[twitches]

[his medication]
The pink ones stop you from screaming!
What you Celebrities must understand is that we own you for life! And the second you're dead, you'll all be dancing around selling toilet cleaner.

[Homer is searching for his soul mate]
I'm more of a well-wisher. Meaning that I don't wish you any specific harm.

[protesting, sees Homer go in]
Mr. Scalper, a ticket please!
I am not a Scalper, I am a dude whose 200 friends did not show up.
[sells her a ticket]
Now what do we do?
Let's talk about Marge behind her back!
Have you noticed her baby never says a thing?
I'll bet it saw something awful!
More testicles means more iron!
My shack! I just got it the way I like it!
If I don't fight him tomorrow, you kids will have a more violent future.
[repeated line]
Yee-haw!
[repeated line]
This blows.
go emotionally dead. Leave your body. Make lots of friends, bye!
Sanctuary!
Oh, why did I teach him that word?
Your hair is tall and pretty!
Thank you Ralph!
[puts her hand on his shoulder]
You really are a nice young gentleman.
Ah! She's touching my special area.
Sigh.
All I want is a friend who's not a work-friend!
I don't know if it's the saltwater in my veins or the nitrogen bubbles in my brain, but I've really taken a shine to you. You're like the son I never had.
And you're like the father I never visit.
You know your problem, Flanders? You're afraid to be Human.
It's the only Behaviour Modification Camp cruel enough to scare kids like Bart straight, and then send them home quietly ticking away...
Summon the Shire-Reeve, wake the Beadle!
We'll do this the same way they pick the Pope. Everyone take an egg from the jar, and whoever gets the black egg is the designated driver.

[afraid she has the Simpsons' stupidity gene]
Is there something I can do to change my DNA like sit on a microwave?
...Not according to any movie I've ever seen.

[reading Gray's Anatomy]
My God! That woman's swallowed a baby!
Science is like someone who tells you the end of a movie before you've watched it! I say there are some things we don't want to know! Important things!
I'm not the kind of Dad who's much fun. But the love is there!
In America, first you get the sugar, then you get the money, then you get the power, then you get the women.

[Monorail criticism]
I could answer your question, Lisa, but you and I would be the only ones in this room who'd understand. And I'm including your Teacher in that.

[Lisa's President in the Future]
Your nutrition and education programs just created a generation of Supercriminals.

[Homer's triple bypass]
Poor Mr. Simpson! I wonder if my Kwikie Mart is in any way connected to his wretched Health?
Could I have five packs of salted jerky, please?
Would you like some Vodka with that?
I can only give you Chewable Prozac for Kids in the shape of cartoon characters. I've got Manic Depressive Mouse, or the Bluebird of Unhappiness.
You can't take revenge on an animal! That's the whole point of "Moby Dick"!
The point of "Moby Dick" is "Be yourself"...
[repeated line]
Lousy _...
[repeated line]
My special little guy.
[repeated line]
Liser Simpson!

[Giving away Santa's Little Helper's new friend]
I want you to have my dawg. Once they fall in love they're no good.
But won't you miss her love and companionship?
Ah-ha-ha-ha! Lady, you're aaaaalright!

[after shooting in the air]
Sorry, I can't live without passion.
I want you to have my hat. I wore it the day Kennedy was shot, and it aaaaaaalways brings me good luck!
And that's how a Hippo became a Deputy.
...Stupid Hippo.
You're the boy that does healing miracles, arrrrrren't ya?
I don't do that anymore. I am no healer.
Arrr. I guess I'll have to find someone else to help me with my crippling depression.
[wanders away]
And I thought he had it all.

[Bart is on Focusin and behaving]
Oh, Bart, you're turning into the kind of boy every Mother wants! A girl!

[environmental presentation]
There will be no Springfield in 20 years! The sea levels will rise, drowning the lowlands! Fields that once fed the World will be reduced to Deserts! And in the New Ninevah, DARKNESS FALLS!
We don't have room for another child.
We'll let Bart sleep in Lisa's room until he leaves home.
Won't that warp him?
It didn't warp my Uncle Frank.
What happened to him?
He joined that Cult. I think he's Mother Shabooboo now.

[the Nahasapeemapetalans have had Octuplets]
I'm sterile, right, Baby Doll?
Yes, dear, from the Nuclear Plant.
Sweet.
[repeated lines]
Who is that man?
That's Homer Simpson, sir. One of your _ from sector 7G.
Simpson, eh?
Spider poison is people poison?
Tell us a story, Grampa, you've led an interesting life.
That's a lie and you know it! But I have seen a lot of movies...
What follows are lies, but they are entertaining lies. And isn't that really what we mean by true? The answer... is no.
Homer, your half-assed underparenting was much easier to put up with than your half-assed overparenting.
But I'm using my whole ass!

[Homer is an ice-cream man]
I've got to get back to my round! If these kids ever make the link between eating right and feeling good, I am screwed!

[Renaissance Costume]
I gets my brain medicines on the Naational 'ealth!
[fishing in a goldfish bowl]
I'm a simple man! I love America, and films where murder is legal one night of the year...
The Nobel Prize! It must be for my hammer which is also a screwdriver, which is mildly convenient.
Just for that?
It was a slow year.
Now who's stupid!
If that's your World, I don't want it!
Did you ever read "The Old Curiosity Shop"?
Name me one person who overcame adversity just on his own!
Balzac!
No need for pottymouth just because you can't think of anyone.
Anything's possible with Captain Cuckoo-Bananas in charge.

[Bird-spotting club]
My God, a Pigeon!
Why would you learn that when you can look it up Online in seconds?
I've... I've filled my head with nonsense!
Yes, you have.
I am so Not British! Don't let my pasty face and rotten teeth fool ya!

[Spanish Armada]
Oh, Lord, please help us kill these foreigners who think your Mother should be revered...
You know, they say there's someone for everybody
[on the other side of the World, Moe's Soulmate hangs herself]
Despite all the Ritalin, Bart has moved on to drugs...
We're getting married! Now when he talks to himself, it'll look like a conversation.
